content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at approximately (2.5, 17.5) – (3.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following connected components that form the interface for copper cable production:
• Cable Factory Input Chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5) – serves as the item inlet.
• Burner Inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) – placed next to the input chest to transfer items.
• Associated source burner inserter retrieved at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5) – part of the upstream feeding chain.
• Assembling Machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5) – linked as the production unit for processing copper cables.

### Belt Depot for Extraction System at approximately (3.5, 15.5)
This depot is intended as the intermediate belt node for receiving items from the extraction network:
• Wooden Chest at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) – placed as the belt depot container.
• Transport Belt Segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) – installed adjacent to the depot chest to extend the belt route.
• Depot Burner Inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) – positioned next to the chest to transfer items from the belt into the depot.
(Note: The extraction network is referenced via a burner inserter at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5), used as the source for belt connections.)

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Belt Connection Target Error
  – Multiple steps report an error stating “Transport belts cannot be connected directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object as a target. You need to add an inserter that inputs items into Prototype.SteamEngine and use the inserter as the target entity.”
  – Tip: Always verify that the final target entity for belt connections is a valid inserter (or similar input device) rather than a steam engine or generator.

• Placement Distance Issue
  – An error occurred when attempting to place a wooden chest at (3.5,15.5) because the player was too far (distance 15.89 versus a max of 10).
  – Tip: Ensure you move closer to the intended placement position so that it falls within the allowed maximum distance.

• Inventory Shortage
  – The agent encountered “No wooden_chest in inventory” when trying to place a chest.
  – Tip: Confirm that the required item is present in the inventory before initiating a placement action.

• Variable Reference Error
  – A NameError (“name 'target_chest' is not defined”) was raised due to referencing an undefined variable.
  – Tip: Double-check variable names and ensure all referenced variables are properly defined and in scope before use.
